alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 1:21PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 121 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in central Cochise County. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Turkey Creek and Ash Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sunizona. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
